Field.Name: ALL
Field.Description: All terms from all searchable fields

Field.Name: UID
Field.Description: Unique number assigned to each sequence

Field.Name: ORGN
Field.Description: Scientific and common names of organism, and all higher levels of taxonomy

Field.Name: PACC
Field.Description: Does not include retired secondary accessions

Field.Name: GENE
Field.Description: Name of gene associated with sequence

Field.Name: PROT
Field.Description: Name of protein associated with sequence

Field.Name: ECNO
Field.Description: EC number for enzyme or CAS registry number

Field.Name: SUBS
Field.Description: CAS chemical name or MEDLINE Substance Name

Field.Name: PROP
Field.Description: Classification by source qualifiers and molecule type

Field.Name: PORG
Field.Description: Scientific and common names of primary organism, and all higher levels of taxonomy

Link.Name: protein_bioproject
Link.Description: Proteins related to BioProjects

Link.Name: protein_biosystems
Link.Description: Pathways and other biosystems containing the current proteins.

Link.Name: protein_cdd
Link.Description: Full list of Conserved domains present in the current proteins as determined by a Conserved Domain Database search using RPS-BLAST. This set includes all domain models that meet or exceed the RPS-BLAST threshold for statistical significance, as well as the conserved domain superfamilies to which they belong.

Link.Name: protein_cdd_concise_2
Link.Description: Concise (top-scoring) list of conserved domains present in the current proteins as determined by a Conserved Domain Database search using RPS-BLAST. For each region on a protein query sequence, this set includes: (a) a specific hit, if one is available, (b) the conserved domain superfamily, and (c) the best-scoring hit that is classified as a multi-domain model, if the alignment is near-complete with respect to that multidomain model footprint.

Link.Name: protein_cdd_summary
Link.Description: Graphical display of conserved domains identified in the protein using RPS-BLAST. The concise results (top-scoring hits) are shown by default, with an option to view the full results, if desired. Click on any domain footprint in the graphical display to see more details and to view the query protein sequence embedded in the domain modelâ€™s multiple sequence alignment.

Link.Name: protein_gene
Link.Description: Gene records referencing the current protein sequence records. Sequences included in Gene records are added manually by NCBI.

Link.Name: protein_genome
Link.Description: Genome records that have the current protein records as annotated features.

Link.Name: protein_homologene
Link.Description: Homologene clusters that contain the current RefSeq protein sequences.

Link.Name: protein_mapview
Link.Description: Graphical Map Viewer display of the current proteins mapped to assembled genomes. Protein sequences are aligned through the corresponding mRNA sequence.

Link.Name: protein_nuccore
Link.Description: Nucleotide records that are the source of protein records in the current set. The protein sequences are generated through translation of coding region features on the nucleotide records.

Link.Name: protein_nuccore_mat_peptide
Link.Description: Source viral genome nucleotide records that have the current proteins annotated as mature peptides.

Link.Name: protein_nuccore_mgc
Link.Description: Order cDNA clones corresponding to Mammalian Gene Collection records that are the sources of the current protein records. The protein sequences are generated through translation of coding region features on the Mammalian Gene Collection sequences.

Link.Name: protein_nuccore_mrna
Link.Description: Link from protein to encoding mRNA

Link.Name: protein_nuccore_wgs
Link.Description: Whole genome shotgun derived nucleotide sequences in the current set that are sources for the current protein sequences. The protein sequences are generated through translation of coding region features on the nucleotide records.

Link.Name: protein_nucgss
Link.Description: Genome survey sequence (GSS) records that are the source of protein records in the current set. The protein sequences are generated through translation of coding region features on the GSS records.

Link.Name: protein_nucleotide_mgc_url
Link.Description: Order cDNA clones corresponding to Mammalian Gene Collection records that are the sources of the current proteins. The protein sequences are generated through translation of coding region features on the Mammalian Gene Collection sequences.

Link.Name: protein_omia
Link.Description: Online Mendelian Inheritance in Animals (OMIA) records that refer to protein records in the current set.

Link.Name: protein_omim
Link.Description: Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man (OMIM) records that refer to protein records in the current set.

Link.Name: protein_pcassay
Link.Description: BioAssay records that refer to protein records in the current set.

Link.Name: protein_pcassay_target
Link.Description: PubChem Bioassay records from screening experiments that test proteins in the current set as a molecular target. Information about biological modulators of the protein target, such as enzyme inhibitors, may be available through the bioassay records.

Link.Name: protein_pcassay_target_pig
Link.Description: PubChem Bioassay records from screening experiments that test proteins with identical sequences to the current set as a molecular target. Information about biological modulators of the target, such as enzyme inhibitors, may be available through the bioassay records.

Link.Name: protein_pccompound
Link.Description: PubChem compound records that cite the protein records in the current set. These compound records are typically associated with protein through a molecular structure containing the both the protein and the PubChem small molecule.

Link.Name: protein_pcsubstance
Link.Description: PubChem substance records that cite the protein records in the current set. These substance records are usually associated with a protein through a molecular structure containing both the protein and the PubChem small molecule.

Link.Name: protein_pmc
Link.Description: Free full-text articles in PubMed central that cite protein records in the current set.

Link.Name: protein_popset
Link.Description: Population, ecosystem, or phylogenetic sets in the PopSet database that include records in the current set.

Link.Name: protein_protein
Link.Description: Protein sequences related by sequence similarity (BLAST) score to the current records.

Link.Name: protein_protein_cdart_summary
Link.Description: Conserved Domain Architecture Retrieval Tool (cDART) results for proteins in the current set. cDART identifies proteins that have similar kinds of conserved domains with similar organization.

Link.Name: protein_protein_identical
Link.Description: Proteins with identical sequences to the records in the current set.

Link.Name: protein_protein_refseq2uniprot
Link.Description: Corresponding UniProt records for Reference Sequence (RefSeq) protein records in the current set.

Link.Name: protein_protein_uniprot2refseq
Link.Description: Corresponding Reference Sequence (RefSeq) records for UniProt protein records in the current set.

Link.Name: protein_proteinclusters
Link.Description: Protein Clusters of conserved proteins from prokaryotes and organelle genomes that contain records in the current set.

Link.Name: protein_pubmed
Link.Description: PubMed articles that cite the protein records in the current set. These are articles that report the International Nucleotide Database Collaboration (DDBJ, EMBL, GenBank) records. These articles are also linked to Reference Sequences derived from the GenBank records.

Link.Name: protein_pubmed_refseq
Link.Description: Link to RefSeq PubMed articles

Link.Name: protein_pubmed_weighted
Link.Description: PubMed articles associated with the current protein record through related Gene database records. These articles include Reference into Function, citations in related OMIM, and those associated with sequences in the Gene record.

Link.Name: protein_snp
Link.Description: Single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) mapped to the current records.

Link.Name: protein_snp_genegenotype
Link.Description: Genotype reports for single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) associated with the current records.

Link.Name: protein_snp_geneview
Link.Description: Geneview in dbSNP showing single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) mapped to the genes associated with the current records.

Link.Name: protein_structure
Link.Description: Three dimensional structure records that are the sources of the protein records in the current set. Each 3D structure and its corresponding sequence data can be viewed interactively in the free Cn3D tool.

Link.Name: protein_structure_related
Link.Description: Graphical summary of three dimensional structures that contain one or more protein molecules similar in sequence to your query protein. Alignment footprints indicate regions of similarity between the query protein and the structure-based protein, with an option to view the 3D structure and corresponding sequence alignment interactively in the free Cn3D tool.

Link.Name: protein_structure_related_list
Link.Description: List of three dimensional structure records that contain one or more protein molecules similar in sequence to the current protein(s). Each 3D structure and its corresponding sequence data can be viewed interactively in the free Cn3D tool.

Link.Name: protein_taxonomy
Link.Description: NCBI Taxonomy entries and classification information for the source organisms of the current set of records.

Link.Name: protein_unigene
Link.Description: UniGene clusters of expressed sequences that contain Reference Sequnce protein records in the current set. Protein records are included in UniGene through sequence similarity to the translations of expressed sequences in the UniGene cluster.
